the spinning speeding up can be attributed to preservation of angular velocity. while collapsing the star becomes smaller, which decreases its size, but the angular velocity remains the same, meaning its linear velocity increases

The "bomb" part I agree is pretty unrealistic, really more of sci-fi

the true answer is, we do not know what happens inside of the black hole. the singularity being infinitely small is a logically incorrect statement, yes, but with the escape velocity (being faster than light) it is the only explanation that really works here atm. Remember; black holes themselves were only theoretical a few years ago...

the video is meant to be appealing, and so it simplifies stuff with analogies. that is why there are always sources in the description, however, barely anybody wants to read those. I am quite interested in this stuff, so I think I can answer questions reasonably well
I still really like that channel, cause it makes learning that stuff actually fun and not boring af

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZFipeZtQM5CKUjx6grh54g well, it is an animation channel. they usually speak about exciting stuff, but when the matter is serious they make sure they facts right. They even made an apology video about oversimplifying complex stuff. If you want some more grounded science speculation concepts I recommend checking out this channel however
